channel.title: neumanncondition
channel.description: Recent articles and posts from neumanncondition.com

item.title: The Quest to Finding Chladni Patterns, Part 1: Theory and Algorithms
item.description: Solve the two-dimensional wave equation via separation of variables and design algorithms to plot Chladni's pattern using the wave equation model.

item.title: Accelerating Feature Extraction and Image Stitching Algorithm Using Nvidia CUDA
item.description: Accelerate ORB, feature matching, warping, seam finding, and image composition using C++ OpenCV and CUDA.

item.title: How to find maxima and minima of an n-th dimensional function
item.description: Utilizing the Hessian matrix and related numerical methods to find maxima/minima/saddle point.

item.title: The Quest to Finding Chladni Patterns, Part 2: Codes and Results
item.description: Plotting a series of Chladni's patterns using the wave equation model.

item.title: My Favorite Problems of All Time
item.description: A collection of some of my favorite math problems that I've encountered throughout the years.

item.title: The Quest to Finding Chladni Patterns, Part 3: The Biharmonic Wave Equation
item.description: Explaining Chladni's patterns via the Biharmonic wave equation model. Introducing the Kirchoff-Love plate.

item.title: Light Refraction and A More In-depth Look of Snell's Law
item.description: Simple idea, complex derivation. Snell's law describe the relationship between the angle of incidence and angle of reflection.

item.title: Time Complexity of an Algorithm
item.description: Theoretical basics about time-complexity of an algorithm, how to measure the time-complexity of a function, examples of algorithms.

item.title: A list of places to munch
item.description: A list of restaurants, cafés, boba spots, and ice cream shops around Los Angeles, nearby areas, California, and beyond that I’ve tried or want to try. I’ll be using this post as a running to-do list.

item.title: A list of tools that I use
item.description: A comprehensive list of software, Chrome extensions, VS Code extensions, and electronics that I use regularly. Why Chrome? I'm too lazy for migration, and it has plenty of cool plugins. Why VS Code? I've tried many text-editors and IDEs before, but I find VS Code to be the most visually pleasing, plus, it's lightweight, and has a large community and number of extensions.

item.title: Silly project idea
item.description: I used Gemini 2.0 Flash API to create an AI bot that writes poetry and plays piano.

item.title: Average engineering experience
item.description: Electrical Engineering: Electrical Circuit Analysis, Spring of 2024.
